content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Facility at Position(5.0, 5.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) used to smelt iron ore and coal into iron plates.

### Copper Smelting Facility at Position(–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Copper Furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0) employed to convert copper ore and coal into copper plates.

Note:
An intended Laboratory at Position(0.5, 2.5) (meant to supply Automation Science Packs for research) was repeatedly targeted for placement and crafting but remains unavailable.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• API Usage Issues with get_entities:
 – Ensure that only the supported parameters are passed. Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or extra positional arguments to match the function’s signature.

• Inventory and Placement Validation:
 – Verify that the necessary entity (such as the Lab) is present in the inventory before attempting placement. Confirm that returned collections (e.g. from get_entities) are not None before iterating over them.

• Lab Crafting Resource Shortages:
 – Check that all required sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, copper-cables, and copper-plates) are available before initiating Lab crafting.
 – Monitor resource counts and ensure proper resource conversion (via smelting) so that crafting prerequisites are met.

• Fallback Handling:
 – When fallback approaches are used (such as defaulting to an empty list for a None result), put in place safeguards to avoid iterating over invalid values.
